ai.summary: Illogan BR 2 is a short, easy 5.3 km hike in the UK. Suitable for beginners, families, and casual walkers, the route follows well-marked paths through rural countryside with gentle gradients and scenic views. The distance is compact, making it ideal for a relaxed half-day outing.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat to gently rolling terrain on well-defined paths. Surfaces vary from compacted gravel and turf to grass verges and occasional mud in wet weather. Expect a few gentle ascents and descents; routes may involve crossing small fields or farm tracks.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and dress in layers. Stay on marked paths and be mindful of mud, uneven ground, and slip hazards. Watch for livestock in fields and gate closures. Carry a map or GPS, water, and a small snack, and tell someone your planned route and timings. If near roads or coastal edges, stay alert for traffic and changing tides.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof walking shoes or boots
Water (at least 500 ml) and a small snack
Lightweight waterproof jacket and an extra insulating layer
Hat, sunscreen and sunglasses for sun protection
Map, compass or offline GPS (or a waypoint stored on your phone)
Phone with a fully charged battery and a small power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring through autumn; the route is most comfortable in milder, drier weather, but can be completed year-round with proper clothing and footwear.
